source_sentence: 佛說閻羅王五天使者經
translation: Sutra on the Five Divine Messengers of King Yama

source_sentence: 宋沙門慧簡譯
translation: Song Dynasty śramaṇa Huiyan Translation

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was present at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「善聽！
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Listen well!

source_sentence: 以置心中。
translation: "Put it in your mind.

source_sentence: 我以天眼徹見眾人生死所趣善惡之道，或有醜惡、或有勇強、或有怯弱，或生善道、或生惡道。
translation: With the divine eye, I thoroughly see the good and bad destinies to which all people are born at birth and death, whether ugly or bad, brave or strong, or weak, and whether they're born in a good path or a bad path.

source_sentence: 凡人所作為皆分別知之。
translation: I discriminate the actions of ordinary people and know them.

source_sentence: 人身行惡口言惡心念惡，謗訕賢聖，見邪行邪，其人壽終，便墮惡道入泥犁中。
translation: When a person's actions are bad, their words are bad, their thoughts are bad, they denigrate the good and the noble, and they see and act wrongly, their life ends, and they fall into a bad path and enter the mire.

source_sentence: 凡人身行善口言善心念善，稱譽賢聖，見正行正，其人壽終，便生天上人間。
translation: When a person behaves well, speaks well and thinks well, praises the good and noble, and sees what's right and acts right, then at the end of his life he'll be born up in heaven or among humans.

source_sentence: 如是，比丘！
translation: Monks, it's like this!

source_sentence: 我以天眼見人終，便生天上人間。
translation: "When I see the end of the human race with the divine eye, I'll be born up in heaven or among humans.

source_sentence: 如是比丘！
translation: Thus, monks!

source_sentence: 我以天眼觀天雨墮水中，見一泡興一泡滅，我見人死識神出生，有好色者、有惡色者，有勇強者、有怯弱者，或生善處、或生苦處；自生自死如水泡無異。
translation: "When I observe with the divine eye a shower of rain falling into water and see a bubble rise and a bubble disappear, I see the birth of a consciousness spirit in the form of a person who dies, whether it's a good-looking person or a bad-looking person, a brave person or a weak person, or whether it's born in a good place or a painful place; their own birth and death are like bubbles of water with no difference.

source_sentence: 復譬如人以五綵縷貫琉璃珠，用珠淨故，縷色青黃赤白黑悉現分明；我見人死魂神出生亦如是。
translation: "Again, like a person who puts five threads of ribbon through a beryl pearl and uses the pearl to purify it, the threads' colors are all clearly visible as blue, yellow, red, white, and black; so I've seen a person's soul and spirit at death be born.

source_sentence: 又如冥夜以明月珠懸著宮門，有人住一面，觀門中出入者，皆一一見之。
translation: It's also like a man holding a bright-moon pearl over the palace entrance on a dark night and observing those who enter and leave through the entrance while standing on one side, and he sees them one by one.

source_sentence: 又如居高樓上望見下人，往者來者走者步者坐者立者，我見人死時魂神出生，端正醜惡勇強怯弱，如所施行，分別知之。」
translation: It's also like looking up from a high building and seeing someone below, someone going or coming, someone walking, someone sitting, or someone standing, and I see the birth of a soul when a person dies, which is correct, ugly, bad, courageous, strong, and weak, and I discern and know it according to how it's performed."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「人生在世間時不孝父母，不敬沙門道人，不行仁義無可用心，不學經戒不畏後世者，其人身死，魂神當墮閻王。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "When a person lives in the world, he doesn't honor his parents, doesn't respect ascetics, doesn't practice kindness and righteousness, has no heart, doesn't train in scriptures and precepts, and isn't afraid of the afterlife, his soul and spirit will fall into Yama's kingdom when he dies.

source_sentence: 地獄主者輙持行，白王言其過惡：『此人非法，不孝父母，不敬沙門道人，不隨仁義，無可用心，無有福德，不恐畏死，當有所見；唯大王處其罰。』
translation: The lord of hell takes voluntary action and tells the king about his faults, saying, 'This person is unlawful, unfilial to parents, a dishonorable ascetic, a failure to follow kindness and righteousness, lacking in resolve and merit, and not fearful of death; only the great king will punish them.'

source_sentence: 如是閻王，常先安徐，以忠正語為現五天使者而問言：『汝本不見，世間人始為嬰兒時，僵臥屎尿不能自護，口不知言語，亦不知好惡者耶？』
translation: Thus, Yama always prepares and presents the five heavenly messengers with faithful words, asking, 'Have you never seen a person in the world who, when they were first a baby, couldn't guard themselves while standing or lying down in bed or in the urine, didn't know what to say, and didn't know good from evil?'

source_sentence: 人言：『已見，皆有是。』
translation: The people said, 'I've seen it, and they all have it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『汝自謂獨不如是耶？
translation: The king said, 'Do you think you're alone in saying that you're not like this?'

source_sentence: 人神從行，終即有生，雖尚未見，常當為善，自端其身端其口端其意，奈何放心快志？』
translation: 'When a person or spirit follows a course of action, he will eventually be born, though he has yet to see it, and he will always do good; he will end his body and end his speech and end his mind, so why shouldn't he rest assured and be pleased with himself?'

source_sentence: 人言：『實愚暗不知故耳。』
translation: The people said, 'It's really because you're stupid and don't know.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝自以愚癡作惡，非是父母師長君天、沙門道人過也。
translation: The king said, 'You yourself have done evil through foolishness, not because of the faults of your parents, teachers, rulers, gods, or ascetics.

source_sentence: 罪自由汝，豈得以不樂故止乎？
translation: Are you free to sin, or can you stop because you don't enjoy it?'

source_sentence: 今當受之。』
translation: I will accept it now.'

source_sentence: 是為閻王現第一天使。
translation: This is the first heavenly messenger of King Yama's present life.

source_sentence: 「閻王復問：『子為人時，天使者次第到，寧能覺不？』
translation: "Again, King Yama asked, 'When you were a human being, could you not have realized that the messengers of heaven came in succession?'

source_sentence: 人言：『實不覺知。』
translation: The people said, 'I really don't know.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝不見世間丈夫母人，年老時髮白齒墮、羸瘦僂步起居拄杖？』
translation: The king said, 'Haven't you seen a worldly man or woman whose hair is white, whose teeth have fallen out, and who is weak and walks with a staff when he's old?'

source_sentence: 人言：『有是。』
translation: The people said, 'Yes, there is.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝謂獨可得不老？
translation: The king said, 'Do you think it's possible to be alone and not grow old?'

source_sentence: 凡人已生，法皆當老，曼其強壯常當為善，端身口心奉行經戒，奈何自放恣？』
translation: All people who have been born will grow old, so they should always be strong and virtuous, and they should properly observe the sūtras and precepts with body, speech, and mind; why should they be careless?'

source_sentence: 人言：『愚闇故耳。』
translation: The people said, 'Foolishness is the reason you're so dark.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝自以愚癡作惡，非是父母君天、沙門道人過也。
translation: The king said, 'You yourself have done evil through foolishness, not because of the faults of your parents, gods, or ascetics.

source_sentence: 罪自由汝，豈得以不樂故止乎？
translation: Are you free to sin, or can you stop because you're unhappy?'

source_sentence: 今當受之。』
translation: I will accept it now.'

source_sentence: 是為閻王正教現第二天使。
translation: This is King Yama's second messenger of the correct teaching in the present.

source_sentence: 「閻王復問曰：『子為人時，豈不見世間男女婦人疾病者，軀體苦痛坐起不安，命近憂促，眾醫不能復治？』
translation: "Again, King Yama asked, 'When you were a human being, didn't you see men, women, and men in the world who were sick, whose bodies were painful, who sat up and became restless, and whose lives were so short that they couldn't be healed by many doctors?'

source_sentence: 人言：『有是。』
translation: The people said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝謂可得不病耶？
translation: The king said, 'Do you think it's possible to not be sick?'

source_sentence: 人生既老，法皆當病，曼身強健當勉為善，奉行經戒端身口意，奈何自放恣？』
translation: 'Since we are old, all phenomena should be sick, so we should strive to be good when we're physically strong and healthy, and we should cultivate the precepts of the sutras and endow ourselves with the body, speech, and mind; why should we be careless?'

source_sentence: 人言：『愚闇故耳。』
translation: The people said, 'Foolishness is the reason you're so dark.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝自以愚癡作惡，非父母君天、沙門道人過也、罪自由汝，豈得以不樂故止乎？
translation: The king said, 'You yourself have done evil through foolishness, not because of the faults of your parents, gods, or ascetics; how could you stop because you're unhappy?'

source_sentence: 今當受之。』
translation: I will accept it now.'

source_sentence: 是為閻王正教現第三天使。
translation: This is the third heavenly messenger of the true teaching of King Yama in his present life.

source_sentence: 「閻王復問曰：『子為人時，豈不見世間諸死亡者，或藏其屍、或棄損之，一日至七日肌肉壞敗，狐狸百鳥皆就食之，凡人已死身惡腐爛？』
translation: "Again, King Yama asked, 'When you were a human being, didn't you see dead people in the world who either hid their corpses or threw them away, where their muscles decayed from one day to seven days and foxes and a hundred birds ate them, or where the bodies of ordinary people who had died decayed?'

source_sentence: 人言：『有是。』
translation: The people said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝謂獨可得不死耶？
translation: The king said, 'Do you think it's possible to be alone and not die?'

source_sentence: 凡人已生，法皆當死，曼在世間常為善，勑身口意奉行經戒，奈何自放恣？』
translation: All mortals are born, and all dharmas will die. Man is always good in the world, and he consecrates his body, mouth, and mind to the precepts of the sutras, so why should he be careless?'

source_sentence: 人言：『愚闇故耳。』
translation: The people said, 'Foolishness is the reason you're so dark.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝自作惡，非是父母君天、沙門道人過也。
translation: The king said, 'You did this evil yourself, not because of the faults of your parents, gods, or ascetics.

source_sentence: 罪自由汝，不得以不樂故止，今當受之。』
translation: You are free to commit this sin, and you can't stop it because you don't like it; now you will accept it.'

source_sentence: 是為閻王正教現第四天使。
translation: This is the fourth heavenly messenger of King Yama's correct teaching manifestation.

source_sentence: 「閻王復問曰：『子為人時，獨不見世間弊人惡子，為吏所捕取，案罪所應刑法加之，或斷手足或削鼻耳，銳掠治刓刻肌膚，熱沙沸膏燒灌其形，裹蘊火燎懸頭日炙，屠割支解毒痛參并？』
translation: "Again, King Yama asked, 'When you were a human being, did you not see bad people and bad sons in the world who were caught by officials, subjected to the punishment appropriate to the crime, had their hands and feet cut, their noses and ears trimmed, their skin cut by sharp strokes, their bodies burned and plastered with hot sand, their heads wrapped in fire and scorched, and their bodies slaughtered, their limbs removed, and their bodies made to suffer from poison and pain?'

source_sentence: 人言：『有是。』
translation: The people said, 'Yes, there is.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝謂為惡獨可得解耶？
translation: The king said, 'Do you think it's possible to understand evil alone?'

source_sentence: 眼見世間罪福分明，何不守善勅身口意奉行經道。
translation: 'When you see the sins and merits of the world clearly distinguished, why don't you keep good commands and devote yourself to the path of the sutras with body, speech, and mind?

source_sentence: 云何自快心？』
translation: How does that make you feel good about yourself?'

source_sentence: 人言：『愚闇故耳。』
translation: The people said, 'Foolishness is the reason you're so dark.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝自用心，作不忠正，非是父母君天、沙門道人過也。
translation: The king said, 'You've been unfaithful in your own mind, not because of the faults of your parents, gods, or ascetics.

source_sentence: 今是殃罪要當自受，豈得以不樂故止耶？』
translation: Now, you will have to suffer this terrible misfortune yourself, so how can you stop because you're unhappy?'

source_sentence: 是為閻王忠正之教現第五天使者。」
translation: This is the fifth heavenly messenger of King Yama's faithful teaching manifestation."

source_sentence: 佛說已，諸弟子皆受教誡，各前作禮。
translation: After the Buddha spoke, the disciples were instructed and each bowed before him.

source_sentence: 佛說閻羅王五天使者經
translation: The Buddha spoke the Sutra on the Five Heavenly Messengers of King Yama.
